alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 9:54AM PST until December 06 at 12:34PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. South Fork Stillaguamish River Near Jordan Rd. Bridge affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rain will continue in the North Central Washington Cascades through this afternoon. Another 1 to 2 inches of rain is forecast before the rain eases late in the day. Rainfall yesterday and today have pushed the Stillaguamish River to major flood category at the Arlington and Jordan Rd. Bridge locations. For the North West Region...including Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillaguamish River at Arlington. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, the Stillaguamish River will cause major flooding. Deep and swift waters will flood many roads including Pioneer Highway...Hwy 530...Marine Drive and Norman Rd. Swift waters will flood residential areas near Silvana...Norman... Florence and Stanwood. Flooding will occur all along the river including headwaters...tributaries...and other streams within and near the Stillaguamish River Basin. A stage of 19 feet on the Stillaguamish River corresponds to Phase 4 in the Snohomish County Flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:05 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:05 AM PST Tuesday was 19.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected crest soon near 19.5 feet and then to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.3 feet on 01/19/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 600 PM PST.
